Hi Duchess,You say you have Graves & your thyroid lab is normal. Have they tested your TSI antibodies (thyroid stimulating immuniglobblins) lately. You can have normal labs with high antibodies. You can also be erythroid (have normal thyroid labs) & have active Graves Eye Disease.I am also a Graves pt. with Graves eye disease. My thyroid labs are normal but my antibodies are still in the active range.It would probably benefit you to see an opthalmologist. (Eye MD) for a check up & also get your TSI antibodies checked.What type of treatment did you have for your Graves during the hyperactive phase? I-131 (ablation) radiation treatment is known to cause GED. You can also get GO if you go hypo on anti-thyroid meds.    Best wishes & God Bless, Jean

Thank you for your concern and information.  When I was diagnosed 4 1/2 years ago with Graves disease I was extrememly hyperthyroid and put on Tapezole.  Recently I was taken off of Tapezole because of other symptoms I had and my thyroid tests have been normal so far.  The eye inflammation, double vision and bulging first started in 1997 and I was given steroids.  Now over the course of almsot 10 years I have had the eye problem sevral times and every time my ophthalmologist says its orbital pseuotumor and prescribes steriods which does help.  Since I have developed so many other neuro. type problems over the past year, I wonder if it is all related?  Ophthalmologist and Endocrinologist both concur that eye inflammtion is not from Graves??!!

question: In 1997 I had severe pain in my left eye and it was bulging.  Doctor had CTSCAN of eye and found that there was inflammation behind eye.  He diagnosed me with Orbital Pseudo Tumor.  I have had several episodes since then always my left eye only.  Last time my doc. wasn't absolutly sure it was OPT, but treated me with steroids and my eye went back to normal. Since I have had other problems over the years ranging from severe neck pain with paralysis to vertigo.  I have trouble physically swallowing sometimes and have had trouble with muscles used for urinating (couldn't feel the urge to go).  I have recently been diagnosed with Gastroparesis.  I do not have diabetes and I do have Graves disease.  Although I am in remission right now and my thyroid has been normal for 3 months so far. I have also had problems with  my ears for years, feeling very cold, fevers of unknown origin, rapid onset of extreme pain in finger, foot, arm leg at different times, heart palps.  As I add up all of these things I wonder if they can all actually from one disorder.
title: Could this actually be neuro problem?
